item.description: ByteDance AI Lab, Speech and Audio Engineering I focused on the refactoring of the existing search engine which provides index and storage of audio fingerprints for almost all of ByteDance’s products. During my three-month internship and with the help from my colleagues, I designed and built the new system architecture that separates storage and computation for the purpose of cloud-nativization. Specifically, I designed and implemented a virtual-consensus-based log system, achieving near 400 Append QPS for log entries of 500KB I optimized the snapshot serialization and deserialization of the in-memory index, achieving 10x speedup on GBs of data.

TalkMeUp Inc. Backend Engineer Intern I had my first internship as a software engineer at TalkMeUp Inc., which was a startup company located in Pittsburgh. It was the first time I got exposed to real industry software development. We used Node.js and React to build our web-based product. My main responsibility surrounded our database. I led the design and implementation of our MongoDB collections to serve our frontend requests. Specifically,
